intro: Typhonium echinulatum, commonly known as the spiny arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (rake-like) leaves. The plant produces an inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in swampy areas.
